title: Why You Should Use Two-Factor Authentication
author: Your Name
content: Two-factor authentication (2FA) is a security process in which a user provides two different authentication factors to verify their identity. These factors can include something you know (such as a password), something you have (such as a smartphone), or something you are (such as a fingerprint). Using 2FA can greatly enhance the security of your online accounts and protect them from unauthorized access. In this article, we'll explore the benefits of 2FA and why you should consider using it for all of your online accounts.
